free_text.Learning outcomes: Principles of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and its applications to medicine and material science. Principles of modern NMR spectroscopy with application to biomolecules.
free_text.Content: [br/][li] Projections of objects using magnetic field gradients.[br/][br/][li] Reconstruction by back- projection.[br/][br/][li] Reconstruction by Fourier transformation.[br/][br/][li] Selective excitation and slice selection.[br/][br/][li] Contrast based on relaxation, diffusion, and contrast agents.[br/][br/][br/][li] Functional imaging.[br/][br/][li] Imaging of flow and angiography.[br/][br/][li] Principles of advanced mag-netic resonance:  concept of coherence transfer and hamilton operators. Applications to metabolites and biomolecules.
